name: Hackatron
about: A flagship hackathon challenging coders to solve real-life problems by developing innovative websites, apps, or desktop solutions.

description.overview: Hackatron is one of our flagship hackathon events...

regionals.overview: Preliminary round where teams submit a project summary.
entry_rules: No registration fees will be charged.
Teams must submit a one-page project summary...
The judges' decision is final and binding.

onsite.overview: Final 36-hour round held at ABV-IIITM for selected teams.
entry_rules: A nominal fee will be charged per team for the Onsite round.

name: Code Rush
about: A high-intensity coding contest testing participants' logic, math, and algorithmic skills through complex problem statements.

description.overview: Code Rush is a challenging coding contest that tests participants' skills...
description.objective: Write a program to solve the given problem statements...

team_composition.team_size: Each team can have up to 3 members.
eligibility: A team must have at least 2 members to be eligible for qualifying...
Teams can be formed across different departments and years.

conduct: Use of any unfair means will lead to disqualification.
Participants must reach the venue well before the scheduled time.

criteria: Number of Problems Solved: Teams are first ranked by the number of problems they have solved...
Time of Last Problem Solved: If teams are still tied...

name: Ideathon
about: A dynamic team-based event challenging participants to solve complex problems through innovation and creativity.

description.overview: Ideathon is a dynamic team-based event where participants...
objective: Teams must analyze and develop a solution for the chosen problem statement...
The solution should be original, innovative, and practically feasible.

event_structure: Multiple problem statements will be provided...
Shortlisted teams will be invited to present their solutions onsite at Infotsav.
participation: Teams must register before the event and adhere to the submission deadlines.
conduct: Any use of unfair means or plagiarism will result in immediate disqualification.

name: Capture the Flag (CTF)
about: An online cybersecurity competition where participants solve challenges to capture flags and accumulate points.

description.overview: Capture the Flag (CTF) is a thrilling online event designed for cybersecurity enthusiasts...
objective: Solve challenges to find and capture hidden flags.
Accumulate the highest points in the shortest amount of time.

event_structure: The CTF will be hosted on an online platform...
The goal is to capture as many flags as possible...
participation: Participants must register before the deadline.
Participants must ensure a stable internet connection...
conduct: Sharing flags with others will lead to immediate disqualification.
